title: Saint jon
author: Saint jon
content: It has been a very good experience, counting that in these months I have had a profit of 5000 with a 10k account.Now the one I am using and recommend is crypto fund trader, but I have also used maven, ftmo, the experience with these has been a little worse.In general the option to start trading with propfirm is an advantage to get started.Also, if you have any doubts about what is a propfirm here is an article https://what-is-prop-trading/I recommend that you try the experience, but you have to be a profitable trader, don't expect it to be that easy.

comments.author: Odohu
comments.body: I don't know if this is the right place for this topic as I'm struggling to wrap my head around it. Anyways, are you aware of the issue with MFF? They were reported to be a ponzi scheme thereby leaving many thinking that other propfirms are just like that.  That issue sends a very bad signal about propfirms. I learnt they have a pending legal case which I feel the outcome will determine the fate of the other propfirms. Nevertheless,  FTMO have been in the business for long and have earned a good reputation.

comments.author: Saint jon
comments.body: Sorry if I have not uploaded the post to the best place It's been shitty what happened with MFF, but I never buy a challenge if I don't trust the company.An example is Cryptofundtrader, I bought a 10k and a 25k But before that I did a search and found that they upload proof of their payments to merchants, they have KYC and on their website they have a Proof Reserve section that gives you confidence that they have a backup. Plus they do copytrading to their traders which other companies don't do. And then there is FTMO which right now is the largest in the sector, but I prefer CFT because it is focused on cryptos.I'll leave a link for you to take a look.https://cryptofundtrader.com?_by=halloweeneventOh and if you want a discount they give it on discord "platinum5"
